intro: Hanceola labordei, commonly known as the laborde's hanceola, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Hanceola labordei is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native habitat.
